alert.note: Alert for Adams; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 10:18AM EST until March 08 at 11:31AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Pulaski, White and Carroll Counties. Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Kosciusko, Starke, Fulton IN, Pulaski and Marshall Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins. Low lands east of Geneva begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.2 feet and slowly falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Tuesday was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.7 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
